summary: The Improving Diaper Affordability Act of 2025 seeks to address diaper need for families. It amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow diapers as qualified medical expenses for Health Savings Accounts, Archer MSAs, and Health Reimbursement Arrangements. It also includes diapers in Dependent Care Assistance. Finally, the bill prohibits state and local governments from taxing the retail sale of diapers.
